inlineContent.text: helps you build custom keyboards with Swift and SwiftUI. It extends Apple‚Äôs native keyboard extension APIs and provides you with more functionality than is otherwise available.
KeyboardKit also provides you with utilities that lets you mimic native iOS keyboards. You can use
and style it as much as you want and customize it with completely custom views or designs.

KeyboardKit Pro extends KeyboardKit with pro features, such as additional locales, autocomplete engines, more extensions, additional views etc. It lets you create fully localized system keyboards with a single line of code.
KeyboardKit Pro supports
and
Although KeyboardKit Pro builds on all platform, some features are unavailable on some platforms.
KeyboardKit Pro can be installed with the Swift Package Manager:
Since KeyboardKit Pro installs as a binary, it only has to be added to the main app target.
The online documentation is currently iOS-specific.
KeyboardKit Pro-specific topics are listed topmost and are prefixed with [Pro].

Note that extensions to native types are not included in this documentation. Future versions of this library will aim at adding protocols for these extensions, to make them appear in the documentation.
KeyboardKit is localized in 60 keyboard-specific locales:

, a

for each locale, which means that the
view becomes fully localized for every available
KeyboardKit Pro is closed source. See the license file in the project repository for more info.

abstract.text: KeyboardKit Pro helps you build custom keyboard extensions for iOS and iPadOS.
This article discusses how get started with KeyboardKit.
This article describes the KeyboardKit feedback engine and how to use it to trigger audio and haptic feedback.
This article describes the KeyboardKit input set engine and how to use it.

s.

to customize

to display an

This class provides U.S. English callout actions.

used to get callout actions for a keyboard action.
This class is by default used as a placeholder autocomplete
provider, until a real provider is injected.
This keyboard lists all emojis from a selected category, as
well as a menu that lets the user select a new category and
change back to an alphabetic keyboard.
This enum defines various license errors that can be thrown
when registering a license key or trying to access features
that require a specific license type.
This class provides a keyboard layout that corresponds to a
standard English layout for an iPad with a home button.
This article describes how KeyboardKit adds ways for you to route text from the main app to other text fields within the keyboard.
This input set can be used in symbolic keyboards.
This enum specifies the various hardware platforms that the

can be valid for.

The keyboard action that this type maps to.

a
and edge insets for an item in

has access to.
Represents a primary return button, e.g.
etc.
This enum can be used to change the drag sensitivity of the
spacebar.
An input set defines the input keys on a keyboard. The keys
can then be used to create a keyboard layout, which defines
the full set of keys, including the surrounding system keys.
This protocol can be implemented by any type that should be
able to access keyboard-specific colors.
This keyboard layout provider implementation can be used to
create standard English keyboard layouts.
This article describes the KeyboardKit gesture engine and how to use it.
This toggle can be used to toggle audio and haptic feedback
on and off.
This article describes the KeyboardKit action engine and how to use it.
This article describes the KeyboardKit appearance engine and how to use it.
This enum contains KeyboardKit-supported locales.
This protocol can be implemented by any type that can check
state state of keyboard extensions.
KeyboardKit Pro helps you build custom keyboard extensions for iOS and iPadOS.
This class can be used to specify what kind of feedback the
current keyboard should give to the user.
This disabled engine doesn‚Äôt do anything and can be used on
platforms where system haptics are not available.
This protocol can be implemented by services that are bound
to a certain locale. It simplifies aggregating services and
resolve the correct service for a certain locale.
